page.title: 08Freeze's farm,North Street.
page.content: {Freeze's Farm House}is 200 years old.The original house has 12 rooms including attics and the cellar.The three attics were for the servants to live in.The front of the house was built in Georgian times, about 1800. The windows at the front of the house are symmetrical.The house has a timber frame and lathe and plaster. The ingredients for the plaster are: 1 part lime,3 parts coarse sand,straw or hay,cow or horse hair.(It was usually coloured white with lime wash.They used sloes for dye.)The roof has hand made clay peg tiles.{Freezes farm}is 305 years old.They produce turkeys at Christmas.They grow winter wheat, oilseed rape,winter barley,spring barley. In the spinney there's some cricket bat willows.There are three barns and the oldest one is 100 years old.
